Longitudinal studies track the same subjects over time. So possible disadvantages could be things like participant attrition, where people drop out over time, which can lead to biased results. Another is the time and cost involved, since it takes a long time to conduct. Also, there might be changes in the environment or societal factors that could affect the results, making it hard to isolate variables. Or maybe the Hawthorne effect, where participants change their behavior because they know they're being studied.
